text:
Gove City is a city in Gove County, Kansas, United States. It is also the county seat of Gove County. In 2010, 80 people lived there.
History.
Gove City was created in 1885. It became the county seat in 1886, and it incorporated in 1888. It is named after Grenville Gove. He was a member of the 11th Regiment Kansas Volunteer Cavalry.
Geography.
Gove City is at (38.959576, -100.487316). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 80 people, 37 households, and 22 families living in Gove City.
Education.
Gove is a part of USD 292 Wheatland. The Wheatland High School mascot is a Thunderhawk.
Gove High School was closed through school unification. The Gove High School mascot was Gove Panthers.
